response_requirements.initial_response_description: Must respond 'promptly'; if information cannot be produced within 10 business days, must notify requestor
response_requirements.final_response_notes: No fixed deadline; agency must provide information 'promptly' and during normal business hours
response_requirements.extension_notes: If information cannot be produced within 10 business days, agency must notify requestor and provide information about when it can be produced
response_requirements.ag_review_timeline: 10 business days to request Attorney General opinion if withholding records; AG has 45 working days to decide (may extend additional 10 days)

fee_structure.search_fee: Not allowed for labor or overhead
fee_structure.search_fee_notes: Governmental body may not charge for employee time spent searching, compiling, or producing records
fee_structure.copy_fee_notes: Reasonable charges for copies and processing; varies by agency and format
fee_structure.electronic_fee: Actual cost of medium (CD, USB, etc.) plus reasonable charges
fee_structure.fee_waiver_criteria: If release of information primarily benefits the general public

exemptions.description: Information considered confidential by constitutional, statutory, or judicial decision
Personnel file information where disclosure would constitute clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy
Information relating to litigation to which state or political subdivision is or may be a party
Information that would harm governmental body's interests in ongoing competitive situation
Information dealing with detection, investigation, or prosecution of crime if disclosure would interfere with investigation or prosecution
Private correspondence or communications of elected office holder relating to matters that would constitute invasion of privacy
Trade secrets and confidential commercial or financial information
Interagency or intraagency memoranda that would not be available to party in litigation
Home addresses, telephone numbers, emergency contacts, social security numbers of public employees and certain other officials
Information related to computer network security, design, operation, or defense

appeal_process.first_level_notes: Governmental body must request Attorney General opinion within 10 business days if withholding information
appeal_process.second_level_notes: Attorney General has 45 working days to issue decision (may extend 10 additional days); requestor may appeal AG decision to court
appeal_process.attorney_fees_notes: Court may award reasonable attorney fees and costs to substantially prevailing plaintiff

requester_requirements.purpose_notes: Requestor identity and purpose are irrelevant to disclosure decision - equal treatment required
requester_requirements.request_format_notes: Written requests required for most requests; oral requests accepted for simple requests
requester_requirements.specific_format: Request must identify specific records with reasonable specificity

agency_obligations.records_officer_notes: Each governmental body must designate officer for public information
agency_obligations.response_format_options: Agency must provide records in requested format if available
agency_obligations.liberal_construction: Statute must be liberally construed in favor of granting requests
agency_obligations.third_party_notification: Must notify third parties if proprietary information may be disclosed
agency_obligations.training_notes: Public officials must complete 1-2 hour training within 90 days of taking office

oversight_body.name: Office of the Texas Attorney General
oversight_body.role: Issues binding opinions on withholding decisions; maintains uniformity in law interpretation
oversight_body.contact_info: Public Information Division, Office of the Attorney General
oversight_body.advisory_committee: Open Records Steering Committee advises AG on public information matters

primary_sources: Texas Public Information Act statutory text
Texas Attorney General Public Information guidance
validation_metadata.verification_notes: All fields verified from official Texas Government Code. Response deadline is 'promptly' with no fixed timeline (variable). If agency cannot produce within 10 business days, must notify requestor. For withholding decisions, agency has 10 business days to request AG opinion; AG has 45 working days to decide. Unique AG review process makes Texas distinct from most other states. Liberal construction required favoring disclosure. Training required for public officials. Fee waivers available if release primarily benefits general public.
